  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Parameters:
      args - main process for the whole game flow

    • setPlayerNumber

      public static int setPlayerNumber()
      Takes as input an integer between 2 and 4 and the loop ends. If it's not an integer, then the exeption will be caught or if the integer is too big or too small and both cases stay in the loop.
      Returns:
      if it's not an integer within the range, then a message returns, else the given integer input returns
      Throws:
      java.util.InputMismatchException - if the input is a invalid input of the type integer

    • setPlayerName

      public static Player[] setPlayerName​(int p)
      Parameters:
      p - is the number of players, which participate the game
      Returns:
      an Array of Players with their names

    • setBoardSize

      public static int setBoardSize()
      We consider to set a minimum of fields to add at least one ladder. We know, it's not necessary to set this restriction, otherwise a too small board doesn't look funny at all.
      Returns:
      an integer with at least 7 fields
      Throws:
      java.util.InputMismatchException - occurs if the user input is doesn't match the integer type

    • setBoardSquares

      public static square[] setBoardSquares​(int boardSize, int nrOfSnakes, int nrOfLadders)
      Parameters:
      boardSize - is the size of the board, which given from the user input by setBoardSize()
      nrOfSnakes - is the number of snakes, which will be set on the board, calculated by setBoardSize()/11
      nrOfLadders - is the number of ladders, which will be set on the board, calculated by setBoardSize()/7
      Returns:
      a board with all square

    • randInt

      public static int randInt​(int min, int max)
      set a range of integer numbers to pick randomly an integer within the range
      Parameters:
      min - integer can also be picked and is smaller or equal than max
      max - integer can also be picked and is greater or equal than min
      Returns:
      a random integer between a range of two integers

    • stateOfTurn

      public static void stateOfTurn​(int p, int boardSize, Player[] players, square[] table)
      Parameters:
      p - is the number of players, which participate the game
      boardSize - is the size of the board, which given from the user input by setBoardSize()
      players - is an Array of Players with their names
      table - is a board with all square

    • isSnake

      public static boolean isSnake​(square test)
      Parameters:
      test - takes a square
      Returns:
      true, if it's a SnakeSquare, true if it's not a SnakeSquare

    • isLadder

      public static boolean isLadder​(square test)
      Parameters:
      test - takes a square
      Returns:
      true, if it's a LadderSquare, true if it's not a LadderSquare

    • resizeArray

      public static int[] resizeArray​(int[] image, int[] tempArray, int tempStart, int tempEnd, java.lang.String type)
      Parameters:
      image - is an Array of integers of the position number of square.squareNr
      tempArray - is a new empty Array of the length of the current image with 2 less squares
      tempStart - is a random integer between the range of the position of the second square and the third last square
      tempEnd - is a random integer between tempStart+1 and the position of the second last square
      type - provides the string "ladder" or "snake"
      Returns:
      an Array without the two square positions, which part of a "snake" or "ladder"
